articleContent.title: Chord: Minor b6th in G# (Shape: E)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: Minor b6th in G# (Shape: E)

## Description
The Minor b6th chord in the key of G# is structured utilizing the E shape. This chord consists of the notes G# (root), B (minor third), D# (perfect fifth), and E (minor sixth). The inclusion of the minor sixth interval gives this chord a unique dark and melancholic sound.

## Notes and Intervals
- G# (root)
- B (minor third)
- D# (perfect fifth)
- E (minor sixth)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Minor b6th chord is commonly found in jazz, blues, and sometimes in pop music. Its dark and haunting sound can create tension and evoke emotions in music. This chord is often used to add a sense of mystery and depth to a song.

## Songs
Here are three songs that feature the Minor b6th chord in the key of G#:
1. "Round Midnight" by Thelonious Monk
2. "Georgia on My Mind" by Ray Charles
3. "The Thrill Is Gone" by B.B. King
